font.b: Closure has been extended until the last day of school, May 14.

div.aria-label: 18 days until Last day of digital instruction

span.font: On February 7th, 2020, 17 students from the Jamestown C-1 FBLA Chapter attended the District 6 Leadership Conference in Moberly. Of those 17 attending, 5 medaled. William Lieser placed first in Agriculture Business, Clarke Rohrbach placed 3rd in Accounting I, and Brooke Stone, Trinity Paulson, and Madelyn Rutledge all placed 5th in Hospitality Management. Their sponsor, Mr. Seth Pirtle, was very proud of their efforts! Well done, Eagles!

font.font: On Saturday, January 4, the Eagles claimed 3rd place in the Stover Tournament defeating the Dixon Bulldogs, 51-43.

During the Tipton Tournament the first week of December, teams were monitored by individuals tasked with selecting one player from each team that exemplified good character and sportsmanship on the court. Ginna Meisenheimer and Tristan Jones were selected for JHS in recognition of their positive attitude.
JHS Senior, Clark Rohrbach, was named KRCG's Student-Athlete of the Week Thursday, December 5. The video can be seen
and the footage of Clark starts at the 5:05 mark.

span.font: Congratulations, Clark, on your success in the classroom, in sports and in life.

font.div: Presenting Mr. Blackmore with the Penny War funds.

div.span: On Monday, November 11, JHS was proud to honor our community heroes at the annual Veterans' Day Assembly in the school's gym. Braving the snowy weather, 30 veterans from all branches of the military attended the assembly.
div.font: During the assembly, a slideshow was presented to honor those that have served or are currently serving from our staff and students’ families, which can be seen here. Our guest speaker, Mr. Gary Blackmore, a veteran himself, spoke on how he serves other veterans through various organizations including the veterans’ hospice, veterans’ court and Central Missouri Honor Flight.

The week prior to the assembly, the students had a Penny War and raised $559.31 which was presented to Mr. Blackmore to give to the veterans’ organization of his choice. He chose Central Missouri Honor Flight to receive those funds.
div.span: Rep. Sara Walsh was also in attendance to honor our veterans.

div.font: On Sunday, November 24, students and staff attended the “Welcome Home
mony for Flight 61 in Columbia to present the funds to the
We are so grateful to those who have given so much on our behalf. Thank you, Veterans!

If your veteran was not featured in this year’s slideshow, please send their photo, name, branch of service, rank, dates of service, who they are related to at JHS and if they are a graduate of JHS along with graduation year to griffinc@jamestown.k12.mo.us.

span.div: On Saturday, Mrs. Cowgill took several students to the Kansas City Renaissance Festival. They enjoyed the shows, faire foods, and some even got Henna Tattoos and costumes.
They had a lot of fun!

span.font: On Thursday, Representative Sara Walsh visited with our 3rd and 4th graders about Missouri government and her role as their representative. She also brought a sample of the "Back the Blue" license plate that she helped sponsor which will be available for citizens to purchase.
Thanks for sharing with us, Rep. Walsh!

b.a: CLOSURE HAS BEEN EXTENDED TO THE END OF THE SCHOOL YEAR, MAY 14. DIGITAL INSTRUCTION WILL CONTINUE UNTIL THAT DATE.

li.a: School Closure and Summer School Cancelation

span.font: Governor Parson has ordered all public schools remain closed for the rest of the school year. Due to this directive and unknown consequences of the COVID-19 pandemic, we also have decided to cancel summer school. Additional information will be provided in the near future.

She will be sending Ms. Roush a link to forward out to parents to access the ZOOM chat for those who would like to participate in Dual Credit Enrollment. Please contact Ms. Roush if you want more information.

br.span: Posted Apr 3, 2020, 7:46 AM by Nickie Dedrick

div.span: Meet Our New Faculty and Staff

div.font: Kelsey is from California, MO and recently graduated from Lincoln University with a Bachelors of Science degree in Psychology. She is in the process of working towards her Masters Degree in School Counseling from Lincoln University. She has been a part of the Jamestown community for 4 years now working at Eagle’s Nest Childcare, while also being the Parents as Teachers Educator for Jamestown the past year. She is excited to continue to be apart of such a great community with a great group of kids!

Nicole grew up in Jamestown. She worked in the banking industry for 10 years before going “back” to school to work at Lewis and Clark MS as administrative assistant to the principal. Nicole and her husband will have been married 12 years in September and have 2 children. She love sports, outdoors and family time. She is very excited to back at Jamestown. This is her home and she is excited to get this journey started.

From 1989 to 2002, Seth lived on an Army base in Tokyo, Japan. In 2003, he graduated from the University of Missouri with a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and in 2010 he received a Master of Arts in Education from Avila University. The 2019-2020 school year will be his ninth year teaching Business.

div.b: Mr. Cody Stegemann, Paraprofessional & Baseball Head Coach

div.div: Cody is from Jefferson City, Missouri. He graduated from Blair Oaks High School. Baseball has always been a big part of his life. His future plans are to not only be a head coach but also be a history teacher as well.

div.span: Strike Out Cancer Pink-out & Bake Sale

div.font: Last night, the softball team was able to raise $1,330 for the National Breast Cancer Foundation with their second annual Pink-out game and bake sale. The amount raised was an increase of $100 over last year. They also came away with a win over Tuscumbia, 6-4.

div.span: Thank you to those that donated the yummy baked goods and to those that purchased. This community is amazing and we appreciate your support of our school. Go Eagles!

span.font: On September 26, at the softball game vs. Fayette, the Lady Eagles with the Jamestown Booster Club recognized several staff members for their positive influence and ongoing support of the Jamestown athletes.

div.span: Congratulations to Jonathan Armistead, Dale Ashley, Jackie Cowgill, Gretta Lieser, Melanie Marshall, John Muri, Andrea Shane, Michelle Sumner and Dixie Trester-Berry.

span.font: Thank you for all that you do for our students!!

i.b: The mission of Jamestown C-1 School is to develop in all its children the strength of character, knowledge, and wisdom to build creative and productive lives.
We believe that educating everyone takes everyone. The school, family, and community working together will enable each child to become successful in our global community.
